result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Sexton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 2.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Jail - 197 days credit applied.  TIME SERVED
Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registry for 5 Years.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent, including sex offender treatment.  Mental Health treatment/counseling if Agent deems appropriate.  No contact with B.F.C. and B.L.S. or their families.  No unsupervised contact with any minor under age of 18 without prior agent approval.  The Court permits contact with the Defendant's minor sister until assessed by agent.  DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. Sex offender registry for 5 years on Count 1.
AMENDED 06-21-0216:  COURT PERMITS DEFENDANT TO HAVE CONTACT WITH MINOR SIBLINGS AS LONG AS DEFENDANT'S PARENTS APPROVE OF THE CONTACT.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit of 127 days were granted.  
Commencing forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with: B.F.C. and B.L.S. or their families.
  No unsupervised contact with any minor under age of 18 without prior Agent approval.
  The Court permits contact with the Defendant's minor sister until assessed by Agent.
  Sex Offender Registry for 5 years.
  Mental Health Counseling/Treatment if Agent deems appropriate.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Fine/Court Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count 2

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS 5 DAYS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 127 days) commencing forthwith.
  -  1 YEAR and 5 DAYS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT;
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
 including sex offender treatment.  
*Mental Health treatment/counseling if agent deems appropriate.
*No contact with:B.F.C and B.L.S. or their families.  
*No unsupervised contact with any minor under age of 18 without prior agent approval.
*The Court permits contact with the Defendant's minor sister until assessed by agent).
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Sex Offender Registry for 5 Years.



Previously ordered FINE/COURT COSTS/ FEES:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision;

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Sentencing 5/11/16
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 10, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 4/4/17; Order transcript.

From State dated 8/30/16 requesting to have register condition to be as a condition of 4th degree sexual assault.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/3/16; Issue and order correcting the JOC to reflect sex registry on one of the Fourth Degree Sexual assaults.

From DOC dated 7/12/16 requesting amendment to JOC; requirement to register as offender to be associated with count 1. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 7/21/16; Amend the JOC accordingly.

From Atty Menden dated 6/14/16 requesting amendment to JOC to allow all minor siblings be excluded from no contact order as long as defendant's parents approve. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/21/16; JOC to be amended accordingly.

COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on Count #2).

Count #2:
  The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

*No unsupervised contact with any minor under age of 18 without prior agent approval.
*The Court permits contact with the Defendant's minor sister until assessed by agent).

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden advises the Court the parties have reached an agreement.    The Defendant is sworn in and waives his right to a jury trial.  Attorney Menden withdraws her request for a speedy trial.    The Court adjourns the trial and sets the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 03-01-2016 08:15 am
Hearing at 02-24-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the competency report filed.  Attorney Menden is not contesting the finding.  Attorney Menden requests the Court amend bail to allow the Defendant to be transferred to the Huber Facility on 15CF1339.  The State objects to the modification of the bail. The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Attorney Menden enters a speedy trial demand on the record.  The Court set 15CF1130 for trial and the other case to tag along.    Hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Motion hearing at 01-06-2016 10:00 am
to moidfy bail filed by Attorney Menden.
Review hearing at 01-06-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden request the Court order a competency report be prepared.  The Court orders a report be prepared and the matter be set for a hearing to review the report.  Attorney Masnica request that court modify bail to $1000.00 cash.  The State objects to any modification of bail.    The Court denies the motion for bail modification.   The Court to prepare order for competency report to be filed by December 30, 2015 in 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Waukesha County Detective Margaret Herrmann sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Juech.  Cross examination by Attorney Menden.  State rests and moves for bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   Attorney Menden requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.   The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing at 10-28-2015 03:00 pm
